Package org.mff

package org.mff

The main package containing all the classes.

The package contans two runnable classes: Server and PlayerClient as well as class Main which takes either "client" or "server" to run them respectively. Package also contains auxiliary classes.

Server and Database

Server is a class responsible for allocating new thread for the clients as well as governing communication between clients and the server, which in turn communicates with database.

Database is a class responsible for managing compain data and compain metadata. Compain data contains player character, while compain meta data contains player - character relations.

Message and MessageType

Message is a class representing a unit of communication between a server and a client. Message contains the String payload and MessageType message type.

MessageType is an enum representing all possible types of messages.

PlayerClient and Character

PlayerClient is a class responsible for client side server client communication as well as client user interface. The command line user interface uses following commands: auth - to reauthenticate, pick - to pick a character, view - to view character, set - to set a field on a character sheet, help - to see the help message.

Character is a class representing a player character. It has all the fields which a character in a DnD game would have as well as ability to set certain field. When one field is set all the field depending on it are updated.

External libraries

The package uses Jackson library to convert Character class to JSON and back whenever such conversion is needed.

    Description
    Character
    Represents character sheet.
    Database

    Main
    Represents entry point into the program.

    Represents the message.
    MessageType
    Represents types of messages.
    PlayerClient
    Represents player client.
    Server
    Represents the server.
    Server.ClinentHandler
    Class responsible for running all the communication with the client in the thread.
